RECORD.TEXT: CTMC 73857414 10/10/1991 12:00:00 AM Unsigned DIS Admission Date : Unsigned 10/11/1991 DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : RECURRENT STAGE 1B CERVICAL CANCER . BONE METASTASES . ANEMIA . PERINEAL RASH . OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES : 1) Bone scan . 2) Blood transfusion . 3) Radiation Therapy consultation . 4) Dermatology consultation . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : She was originally diagnosed with cervical cancer in May of l989 . There were positive margins and positive nodes . in December of l990 , she had a vaginal apex mass on examination . Cystoscopy and proctoscopy were negative . A CT , however , confirmed a large pelvic mass with bilateral hydronephrosis . A biopsy of the mass revealed poorly differentiated metastatic small cell neuroendocrine tumor . Between March and May of l990 , she received two cycles of chemotherapy in two parts alternating Cisplatin and VP-l6 with Vincristine , Cytoxan , and Adriamycin . In June of l990 , she underwent radiation therapy and in July of l99l , a right ventriculogram showed an ejection fraction of 48% . Her chemotherapy was then changed to a single agent of Cytoxan . Orthopedic Surgeons did an open reduction and internal fixation of a lytic lesion involving the right femur . On July 30 through August 4 of l99l , she received her first cycle of Ifosfamide and Mesna . She had prolonged neutropenia and on August 28 , she was admitted with a headache . CT scan at that time was normal . On September 6 , she began the next cycle of second line chemotherapy consisting of Carboplatin , Ifosfamide , and Mesna . Since the last cycle of chemotherapy , she has had continued right hip pain and right mid lateral abdominal discomfort . She was started on Zovirax on October 3 . She presents for a bone scan , blood transfusion , and consideration of her third cycle of second line chemotherapy . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : As above . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Radical hysterectomy in May of l989 , open reduction and internal fixation of femur in July of l99l , and examination under anesthesia , cystoscopy , and proctoscopy in December of l990 . PAST OBSTETRICAL HISTORY : Spontaneous vaginal delivery times three . Zovirax 200 mg five times daily , Methadone 50 mg t.i.d. , and Ativan p.r.n. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : HEENT : CHEST : Clear to auscultation . Regular rate and rhythm . there was no distinct costovertebral angle tenderness . ABDOMEN : There was mild tenderness to palpation in the right mid lateral abdomen . There were no peritoneal signs and no guarding . Without edema . PELVIC : There was a dry scaly rash with multiple small scabs on the left perineum and posterior thigh . Her electrolytes were within normal limits , her BUN was ll , and creatinine was 0.8 . Her ALT was l0 , total bilirubin 0.4 , and magnesium was l.8 . Her admission CBC revealed a white blood count of 2.27 , with 56 polys and 3 bands . Her hematocrit was 22.9 and platelets were l24 . HOSPITAL COURSE : There was noted , however , to be new pain in the right shoulder and , in fact , there was a lytic lesion involving the right shoulder and femur . Plain film revealed a moth-eaten appearance consistent with probable new metastases . The Radiation Service was consulted and noted that past areas treated including her right femur , her thoracic spine , pelvis , and right posterior ribs had all responded to radiation therapy and agreed that treating the right shoulder humerus and the right hip which had not been previously treated was reasonable . Planning for further radiation therapy was arranged for next week by the Radiation Service . She was also seen by the Dermatology Service who examined the rash and felt it was most likely a contact dermatitis . She was given Synalar Cream and Eucerin Cream as a moisturizer . Due to Dr. Friednantflirt 's concern that the tumor was growing despite the available chemotherapeutic regimen , the Im Villtro University Medical Center Medical Oncology Service was consulted . However , they felt that at the Venbonlea Health , there were several possible options including a possible phase I trial regimen . On the evening of 12/26/06 , the patient was discharged home in stable condition . DISPOSITION : Methadone l5 mg p.o. t.i.d. , Synalar Cream b.i.d. , and Eucerin Cream . SB325/2198 LAKO C.
